spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Pazuzu's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

3e: {@spell plane shift} (only itself and willing creatures)

trait.name: Aura of Servile Avians
entries: Any evil creature with a natural fly speed and a CR of 20 or less must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw if they attempt to attack Pazuzu. Failure means their action is wasted and the attack fails. On a successful saving throw the target is immune to this effect in the future.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Pazuzu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Pazuzu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spell Disruption
entries: When Pazuzu casts {@spell dispel magic}, he automatically dispels any spell of 6th level or lower on the target.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage. As a bonus action Pazuzu can activate this sword's special feature which grants him haste until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: Pazuzu exhales poisonous acid in a 100-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Every creature caught in the cone must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw. Each creature takes 63 ({@damage 18d6}) acid damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this breath weapon melts and is disintegrated.

legendary.name: Disarm
entries: Pazuzu knocks a weapon out of a target's hand if his attack roll (+14) beats the target's Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. If disarmed, the target's weapon flies 10 ft. in a random direction.

legendary.name: Lethal Leap
entries: Pazuzu attacks once with his greatsword or talons and can then fly away. Pazuzu's movement does not provoke attacks, whether he hits or not.
